title: Bug 6410 - File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: When using code assist in a Java file, if there are no suggestions, the file should not be marked as modified.
OB: When using code assist in a Java file with no suggestions, the file is marked as modified even though no changes were made.
EB: When using code assist in a Java file with no suggestions, the file should remain unchanged.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
3. Press Ctrl+Space to invoke code assist.
